qas.question: What  religion is credited by some authors from the west for initiating the story of the conceiving of Mary ?

answers.text: claim that the immaculate conception of Mary is a teaching of Islam.

qas.question: What do these authors use in the form of proof for credit given to the other religion  ?

answers.text: passage in the Qur'an, "I have called her Mary; and I commend her to thy protection, and also her issue, against Satan driven away with stones

qas.question: According to the teaching of this other religion what occurred to Mary during the birth of her first child ?

answers.text: Mary and her son only excepted; between whom, and the evil spirit God placed a veil, so that his touch did not reach them.

qas.question: What does this other religion also state  happens  to everyone besides Mary and her First born child  ?

answers.text: every person that comes into the world, is touched at his birth by the devil

qas.question: What does the event cause to happen to everyone but Mary and her first born child ?

answers.text: every person that comes into the world, is touched at his birth by the devil, and therefore cries out,

qas.question: Who does Islam claim first taught the immaculate conception of Mary?
Who says it is not that the concept of the Immaculat conception is taken from the Qur'an?

plausible_answers.text: immaculate conception of the virgin Mary

qas.question: What does the Qur'an say is pretended?

plausible_answers.text: touched at his birth by the devil

qas.question: What does the Bible say happens to every person that comes into the world?
What did the Holy Spitit place between Mary and the devil?

context: Some <b5_0>Western writers<b5_0/> <a0_0>claim that the immaculate conception of Mary is a teaching of Islam.<a0_0/> Thus, commenting in 1734 on the <a1_0>passage in the Qur'an, "I have called her Mary; and I commend her to thy protection, and also her issue, against Satan driven away with stones<a1_0/>", <b6_0>George Sale<b6_0/> stated: "It is not improbable that the pretended <b7_0>immaculate conception of the virgin Mary<b7_0/> is intimated in this passage. For according to a tradition of Mohammed, <a3_0><a4_0>every person that comes into the world, is <b8_0>touched at his birth by the devil<b8_0/><a3_0/>, and therefore cries out,<a4_0/> <a2_0>Mary and her son only excepted; between whom, and the evil spirit God placed <b9_0>a veil<b9_0/>, so that his touch did not reach them.<a2_0/> And for this reason they say, neither of them were guilty of any sin, like the rest of the children of Adam."
